verses.text: 信心使我們勝過世界凡信耶穌是基督的，都是從 神生的，凡愛那生他的，也必愛那從他而生的。

words.note: In biblical context, refers to spiritual faith.
Often used in biblical Chinese as 'everyone who' or 'whatever'.
Refers to God, the divine being.
Often used in biblical Chinese as 'everyone who' or 'whatever'.
Connects clauses, indicating consequence or manner.

verses.text: 我們若愛 神，並且遵行他的命令，就知道我們是愛 神的兒女了。

words.note: Refers to God, the divine being.
Refers to God, the divine being.

verses.text: 我們遵守 神的命令，就是愛他了；而且他的命令是不難遵守的，

words.note: Refers to God, the divine being.

verses.text: 因為凡從 神生的就勝過世界。使我們勝過世界的，就是我們的信心。

words.note: Often used in biblical Chinese as 'everyone who' or 'whatever'.
Refers to God, the divine being.
In biblical context, refers to spiritual faith.

verses.text: 勝過世界的是誰呢？不就是那信耶穌是 神的兒子的嗎？

words.note: Combined with '不' and '是', implies 'isn't it just' or 'it is none other than'.
Refers to God, the divine being.

verses.text: 神為他兒子作的見證那藉著水和血來的就是耶穌基督，不是單用水，而是用水又用血；作見證的是聖靈，因為聖靈就是真理。

words.note: Often used in philosophical/religious contexts.

verses.text: 原來作見證的有三樣，

words.note: Here means 'those who give testimony'.

verses.text: 就是聖靈、水和血，這三樣是一致的。

words.note: Lit. 'reach oneness'.

verses.text: 我們若接受人的見證， 神的見證就更強而有力了，因為這是 神為他的兒子作的見證。

words.note: An idiom meaning 'strong and effective'.

verses.text: 信 神的兒子的，就有這見證在他心裡；不信 神的，就是把 神當作說謊的，因為他不信 神為他兒子所作的見證。

words.note: In this context, refers to religious belief/faith.
Here means 'those who believe God's son'.
In this context, refers to religious belief/faith.
Here means 'those who do not believe God'.
Used to mark the object of a verb.
A verb-object compound.
Here means 'a liar' or 'one who lies'.
In this context, refers to religious belief/faith.
Forms a nominal phrase with the following verb.

verses.text: 這見證就是 神已經把永遠的生命賜給我們，這生命是在他兒子裡面的。

words.note: Often used in biblical context for 'eternal life'.
Used spiritually as 'eternal life'.
Used spiritually as 'eternal life'.
In biblical context, refers to 'Son of God'.

verses.text: 凡有 神兒子的，就有生命；沒有 神兒子的，就沒有生命。

words.note: Often used in formal or literary contexts.
In biblical context, refers to 'Son of God'.
Here means 'those who have...'
Used spiritually as 'eternal life'.
In biblical context, refers to 'Son of God'.
Here means 'those who do not have...'
Used spiritually as 'eternal life'.

verses.text: 要照 神的旨意祈求我把這些事寫給你們信 神的兒子之名的人，是要你們知道自己有永生。

words.note: In biblical context, refers to 'Son of God'.
A more literary equivalent to '的'.
Here means 'people who believe in...'

verses.text: 如果我們照著 神的旨意祈求，他必聽我們；這就是我們對 神所存的坦然無懼的心。

words.definition: particle indicating an action or object

words.note: A four-character idiom (成語).

verses.text: 既然我們知道他聽我們的祈求，我們就知道，我們無論求甚麼，他必賜給我們。
如果有人看見弟兄犯了不至於死的罪，他就要祈求， 神必因他的緣故，把生命賜給那些犯了不至於死的罪的人；有至於死的罪，我不說他應當為那罪祈求。

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to a fellow Christian.

breakdown.m: as for, to the extent of

words.note: Lit. 'not to the extent of death'.
The blank space is a reverence mark in Chinese Bibles.

breakdown.m: as for, to the extent of

words.note: Lit. 'not to the extent of death'.

breakdown.m: as for, to the extent of

words.note: Lit. 'to the extent of death'.

verses.text: 一切不義都是罪，但也有不至於死的罪。

breakdown.m: as for, to the extent of

words.note: Lit. 'not to the extent of death'.

verses.text: 我們知道凡從 神生的就不犯罪，而且從 神生的那一位也必保守他，連那惡者也不能碰他。

words.note: The blank space is a reverence mark in Chinese Bibles.
The blank space is a reverence mark in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to Jesus Christ in this context (1 John 5:18).
Refers to Satan.

verses.text: 我們知道我們是屬於 神的，而整個世界是伏在那惡者手下。

words.note: The blank space is a reverence mark in Chinese Bibles.
Often implies being subdued or under control.
Refers to Satan.
Idiomatically means 'under someone's authority/control'.

verses.text: 我們知道 神的兒子已經來了，並且賜給我們悟性，使我們能認識那位真實者。我們也在那位真實者裡面，就是在他兒子耶穌基督裡面。這一位就是真神，也是永遠的生命。

words.note: The blank space is a reverence mark in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to God or Christ.
Refers to God or Christ.

verses.text: 孩子們，你們要保守自己遠離偶像。

words.note: 孩子 means 'child', 們 is a plural suffix for people.
你 means 'you', 們 is a plural suffix for people.
A modal verb indicating necessity or intention.
Literally 'protect and guard', often used reflexively as 'keep oneself'.
A reflexive pronoun.
To be distant and separate from something.
Refers to a sculpted image or representation worshipped as a deity.
